comment: Great prof, has clear criteria for the papers, and makes it obvious what the tests will be over. Very considerate of student's situations as well, very reasonable
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Such a great professor, she guides you to get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Caring

comment: Dr. Creel is an amazingly kind person who is truly enthusiastic about British Literature. Even though I am not extremely fond of reading and writing, Dr. Creel made taking my last English class at KSU an awesome experience. In the class there was two tests, 10 discussion posts, a group project, and a few in class writing assignments.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Dr. Creel is super sweet and helpful. She will walk you through every task in the class and make it as understandable as possible. 11/10 would take again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Caring

comment: Dr. Creel is an extremely caring and understanding professor, and she made my last literature class I had to take an amazing experience. British Literature was made fun and interesting because of Dr. Creel, and I truly enjoyed going to her class everyday. I read some amazing short stories that I never would have if I didn't take this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Not recommended for freshman. The assignments are toughly graded and there isn't much room for mistakes. Definitely don't take this if you can't dedicate a good amount of time to this class. There is a group project.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Creel is an amazing professor and really helped our class enjoy British Literature. She really took her time to give helpful feedback on each assignment. If you are not a fan of english the midterm and final can be difficult, but if you love reading its a piece of cake. Her lectures are amazing and finds great ways to relate to the students.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Creel is one of the nicest and most understanding teachers I have ever had. She is young so she relates to college students well. We had two papers and a large group presentation. Although she spends time grading papers and grades them closely, it is very helpful because she gives you great feedback. Definitely take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Great professor! She is very funny and tells you exactly what you should be doing and helps you successfully do it. She doesn't want you to fail. I would definitely take her again.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Creel is hands down the best professor to take for any English class. Her projects and assignments are easy A's as long as you put in some effort.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Caring

comment: She is really good professor. She explains well for everything. Find good partner for peer review. There is one group project and 3 assignments. There is no final (only portfolio). She is slightly lenient. She is tough grader, but it helps you to learn something. However, she is really nice.

Very good professor. Seems to really care about students. Don't underestimate the power of an email explaining circumstance. Very understanding of mental health and wants you to do well. There was one final and one midterm, one essay, one group project. Read and don't skip and you'll do well. Reading matters b/c exams are written, not multi choice.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She is the best! She taught at Southern Poly before the merger and doesn't hold us up to the expectations that we care about her class. She cares about each of her students, no matter how many. She does expect class participation. She only requires that you read each book that she assigns.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: One of the best I've taken so far. Course is structured for the students to learn in a very efficient way. Gives great feedback on everything. Papers are simple. Reading is enjoyable b/c of the book choices. Take her, she's good.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Great, really sweet professor. Participate in class, organize your ideas, and you will do well on quizzes and essays.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Great teacher. This is the only class I participated in discussion. Have to read before every class. Few grades so take them serious. She is very willing to help. A's are only made in this class by actually dedicating time to studying and reading.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Creel is a very caring professor who is willing to work with students if they are struggling to meet a deadline and explain circumstances ahead of time. Show up to class because you won't pass if you miss six classes. The assignments are easy and she is always asking if anyone has questions. She has a great personality and is easy to speak with.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Creel is suuuuper nice, and if you show up to class and do the readings you should be fine. She's a very thorough grader. You can't be vague with your answers, make sure you go into detail and understand the material. She's very understanding, and she will help if you go to her. There are pop quizzes and the midterm/final isn't multiple choice.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: One of the best professor's I've taken! She is very helpful and definitely cares about her students. The work isn't too difficult either. Definitely recommend.

Such a kind person! She's funny and very accommodating to the students on that campus.  There is a presentation that  is easy enough but she lets the presentation do part of the teaching. Sometimes the material can be dry. The final exam is cumulative and worth 35% of your grade. She plays jeopardy and the in-class writing assignments are open book
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Great teacher. You know what to expect from day 1. Do everything she assigns and it is an easy A as well as an enjoyable class. Readings are not bad, nor are essays. Peer reviews are common so find a good partner to sit next to on day 1. You will be doing group projects and such so find good friends early. Easy to be on her good side.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Creel is amazing. She truly cares about her students and does her best to make class enjoyable. In-class writing assignments were easy A's, but she made us work for our essay grades. Overall, 10/10 would recommend.
rating_tags: Respected--Inspirational--Caring

comment: Dr. Creel is one of if not the best teacher I have ever had in college.  She is respective of that fact that she teaches dozens of apathetic teenagers, and tries to relate and teach to their perspective.  Her work is not challenging, and she is one of the kindest people I have ever met. 10/10 would rate again.
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: This class is VERY reading-heavy, but with few actual assignments. There are only two tests, which are in class writing assignments, plus the midterm and final. There are a lot of pop quizzes and you have to do a presentation (but only one). Dr. Creel herself is wonderful! She's super sweet and funny and caring.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Professor Creel is amazing! She gives you great feedback and always encourages anyone to go see her if they're struggling in class.  Would definitely take again anytime!
Creel is an absolutely amazing teacher. She is truly concerned of her students' well-being, and teaching them how to be a better writer.

Creel is awesome! There are a lot of assignments, but the majority are small in-class writing paragraphs. The essays are the big chunk of your grade and Writer's Help (a website she highly recommends you to use) can really help. Two textbooks are required for this course, but they don't go to waste. She is hilarious and I would take her again.
A lot of in class quizzes over the reading, but the main bulk of your grade are the essays. The essays are not to hard and there are in class writing labs and peer reviews.

There's a lot of grades, but they don't amount to much in the end. The essays take the biggest chunk, and she gives you plenty of time to write them and get them reviewed. She creates mandatory readings that help you in your assignments, however you are quizzed over them often. Attendance, engagement, and participation are strictly required.
